title: Week 6 – Unit 4 (The Shrinking World): Possibility + Future Forms
targets: Grammar: may/might/could (possibility) + will / be going to / Present Continuous (arrangements)
Reading: فكرة عامة + تفاصيل + مرجع ضمير/مرادف
Listening: استماع موجّه عن ترتيب اجتماع عبر الإنترنت
Writing: Questionnaire → Mini-Report (6–8 جمل: نتائج + خطة)

vocabulary.ex: This device is easy to use.
There is no coverage in the basement.
Do you have access to the platform?
Share the file with your group.
My prediction is that we will finish early.
Dark clouds are evidence it is going to rain.

grammar.title: Future Forms: will / be going to / Present Continuous
grammar.when: will: قرار لحظي/رأي عام؛ be going to: نِيّة/خطة أو تنبّؤ بدليل؛ Present Continuous: ترتيب مؤكد (موعد)، وقت/مكان محدّد
grammar.form: will + V | am/is/are going to + V | am/is/are + V-ing (مع وقت/مكان)

grammarPractice.q: We ___ (meet) the engineer at 10; it's on the calendar.
Look at those dark clouds — it ___ rain soon.
We use 'will' for fixed arrangements with time/place.

reading.pre: توقّع: كيف تجعل التطبيقات الحديثة العالم يبدو “أصغر”؟ وما المخاطر إن أفرطنا في استخدامها؟
reading.text: With fast communication, the world feels smaller. Students can share messages, files, and ideas across cities in seconds. Clubs arrange online meetings, and teachers announce changes quickly. However, privacy and focus still matter: not every message needs an instant reply. Small rules—like turning off notifications while studying—help students stay calm and productive.

choices: Fast tools connect people, but we must use them wisely.

tasks.q: The text says clubs can arrange online meetings.
The pronoun 'them' in 'use them wisely' refers to:
The speaker suggests arranging a video meeting with a clear time.

choices: a time that suits all time zones

writing.prompt: Questionnaire → Mini-Report (6–8 جمل): (1) فكرة الاستبيان، (2) نتيجتان رئيسيتان (may/might/could عند الحاجة)، (3) خطة بسيطة للأسبوع القادم مع ترتيب واضح (We are meeting on … / We are going to … / We will probably …).
tips: Use Present Continuous for fixed arrangements: We are meeting on Tuesday at 6.
Use be going to for plans/intentions: We are going to create a study group.
Use may/might/could for possibility: We might use the school platform.

items.q: I think they ___ (finish) the task tomorrow.
We ___ (have) a meeting at 5; it's already in the diary.
Look at the schedule — they ___ (present) at 4.
It ____ (could / be) delayed if the connection is weak.
We ___ (meet) the new teacher now. It’s a fixed plan.
'be going to' can show a plan/intention.
The clouds are very dark; it ___ rain.
